sen.j: 宇田川 玄随（うだがわ げんずい 宝暦5年12月27日 (旧暦)（1756年1月28日） - 寛政9年12月18日 (旧暦)（1798年2月3日））は医学者、蘭学者。
sen.e: Genzui UDAGAWA (January 28, 1756 - February 3, 1798) was a physician and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language).
Genzui UDAGAWA (January 28, 1756 - February 3, 1798) was a physician and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language).
Genzui UDAGAWA (January 28, 1756 - February 3, 1798) was a physician and Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language).
His first name was Shin and he was commonly known as Meigyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 晋、明卿の読み不明
sen.e: His first name was Shin and he was commonly known as Meigyo.
His first name was Shin and he was commonly known as Meigyo.

sen.j: 号は槐園（かいえん）または東海（とうかい）。
sen.e: He was also known under the name of Kaien or Tokai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was also known under the name of Kaien or Tokai.
He was also known under the name of Kaien or Tokai.

sen.j: 代々江戸詰の津山藩医を勤める家系に生まれる。
sen.e: He came from the family of doctors of the Thuyama Domain working in Edo for generations.
He came from the family of doctors of the Tsuyama Domain working in Edo for generations.
He came from the family of doctors of the Tsuyama Domain working in Edo for generations.

sen.j: 元来は漢方医であったが、杉田玄白・前野良沢らと交流するうちに蘭学へと転向する。
sen.e: He had originally been a Chinese medicine doctor but turned to become a Rangakusha as he interacted with Genpaku SUGITA and Ryotaku MAENO.
He had originally been a Chinese medicine doctor but turned to become a Rangakusha as he interacted with Genpaku SUGITA and Ryotaku MAENO.
He had originally been a Chinese medicine doctor but turned to become a Rangakusha as he interacted with Genpaku SUGITA and Ryotaku MAENO.
He adopted Genshin UDAGAWA.
He adopted Genshin UDAGAWA.
He adopted Genshin UDAGAWA.

sen.j: 『西説内科撰要』－ヨハネス・デ・ゴルテル著の『簡明内科書』の訳書で日本初の内科書。
sen.e: "Seiyo Naika Senyo" (Selected Points of Western Theories on Internal Medicine) - a translation of Johannes de Gorter's "Kanmei Naikasho"and the first book on internal medicine in Japan.
"Seiyo Naika Senyo" (Selected Points of Western Theories on Internal Medicine) - a translation of Johannes de Gorter's "Kanmei Naikasho"and the first book on internal medicine in Japan.

sen.j: 『ハルマ和解』－編纂に参加・協力した。
sen.e: "Haruma Wage" (Halma Explained in Japanese) - joined as a compiler.
